meta.Agreement: Use of the APIs and any related data will be subject to the terms of the Open Licence and subject to terms and conditions

data.ProductDescription: An account with a range of benefits for a £15 monthly fee.   Includes   worldwide family travel insurance, AA Breakdown, mobile phone insurance and home emergency cover. A lower monthly fee of £12 applies if in the previous calendar month you pay in £750 or more, pay out at least 2 different direct debits and remain in credit.
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: covers winter sports and Golf trips, covers Uk trips where accomoadation is pre bookedfor 2 nights or more Includes cover for personal belongings up to £2500, single article, pair or set of articles up to £500, Valuables up to £500 in total personal Money up to £750 ( cash £300)
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue:
•Cover ceases fully on your 71st birthday
•Cover includes your spouse, civil partner or partner (who you live with) and children under 18 or under 24 and in full time education. Children are covered when travelling with the holder(s) of the Ultimate Reward Current Account or a Responsible Adult
•Pre-existing medical conditions are not covered unless agreed by the insurer
•The maximum trip duration is 45 consecutive days, for Winter sports a maximum 31 days cover in any calendar year
•You will pay a maximum excess of £50 per claim.

FeatureDetails.FeatureName: AA break down cover including Home start
FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
•Provides cover within the UK, Channel Islands and Isle of Man
•Roadside Assistance
•Home Start
•Customer covered, not the vehicle.
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue: Does not include AA Relay, which would recover you to any single UK destination of your choice. Under this cover if it is not possible to fix the vehicle at the road side, you will be recovered to a local repairer of the AA's choice or a destination of your choice provided it is no further

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: One phone per account holder, maximum of two for Joint accounts. Repair or replacement phone up to a maximum value of £2000 (including VAT) per claim. It covers for loss, theft, damage or breakdown (including faults).
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue: An excess is payable on all successful claims.  For Apple Iphones its £50 for damage and  breakdown claims and £100 for loss and theft claims.  For all other handsets its £30  for all claims

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: Covers a sudden unexpected incident to your home which needs immediate action to: make it safe or secure and avoid damage or more damage. Make it fit to live in. Restore electricty, gas or water services if they have totally failed. Provides a qualified person chosen by us to deal with the emergency up to £250
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue: the policy deals with home emergencies needing immediate attention only and will cover costs up to a maximum of £250, it does not cover broken freezers for example

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: An overdraft buffer so you won't get any fees on the first £50 you go overdrawn

A lower monthly fee of £12 applies if in the previous calendar month you pay in £750 or more and pay out at least 2 different direct debits and remain in credit. You'll also need to keep your account open/not change it to a different current account until the fee is due to be debited (by the 2nd working day of the following calendar month).

Eligibility.Description:
To apply for a Lloyds Bank Student Account you must be 17 or over, have been a resident in the UK for at least three years and be studying for a full-time course that lasts for a minimum of two years or be on a one year access course leading onto a full-time degree.  
To apply for a Halifax Ultimate Reward Current Account you must be 18 or over and a UK resident.

OverdraftPricing.OverdraftNotes: Monthly charges are based on maximum of 35 days if month ends with Bank holidays.Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month, the account fee will be £15 instead of £12
Monthly charges are based on maximum of 35 days if month ends with Bank holidays.Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month, the account fee will be £15 instead of £12

No daily overdraft fees if you are in debit by £50.00 or less.Monthly charges are based on maximum of 35 days if month ends with Bank holidays.Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month, the account fee will be £15 instead of £12
Daily charge has maximum of 20 charges within any billing period. Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month, the account fee will be £15 instead of £12

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: Payments up to and including £100;
Payments over £100;

Non-sterling purchase fee: fee charged per transaction when you make a purchase (not a cash withdrawal or purchase of foreign currency or travellers cheques). fee is applicable only to debit card transactions. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

Non-sterling cash fee :fee charged for withdrawal of cash abroad using your debit card. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

FeeDetail.Other: Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account for sterling value of £100 or less,whether negotiating or collecting

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: For cheque values <= £100, whether collecting or negotiating
For cheque values over £100: our minimum charge will be £15 when we collect the cheque.

Non-sterling transaction fee: fee charged for the conversion of currency. This is a percentage value of your original transaction. 
The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

FeeDetail.Other: Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account for sterling value more than £100 where we negotiate the cheque

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: For cheque values over £100: our minimum charge will be  £8  when we negotiate the cheque

A lower monthly fee of £12 applies if in the previous calendar month you pay in £750 or more and pay out at least 2 different direct debits and remain in credit. You'll also need to keep your account open/not change it to a different current account until the fee is due to be debited (by the 2nd working day of the following calendar month).

Foreign cash fee : fee charged if you choose to complete your debit card cash withdrawal using the ATM provider's conversion rate to sterling. The ATM provider may make a separate charge for conversion which will be included in the exchange rate offered to you. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

BenefitDetail.BenefitDescription: Get up to 15% cashback using Cashback Extras at the type of places you regularly shop. It’s available to UK personal current account customers over 18, who bank online. Retailer offers and cashback amounts may vary.

1) Two people using one account - A simple way to share spends and see them on one monthly statement
2) Both account holders get a Visa debit card
3) Both account holders can also separately set up and manage Online Banking

Sign up for our Text Alerts, which can help you keep track of your finances. Limit Alerts tell you if you're near to or over your account limit. You can also get Balance Alerts that let you know when your balance is above or below a level set by you.

£75 extra, paid before your switch completes. Just use the Current Account Switch Service to transfer and close your old account held elsewhere. If you’ve received cashback for switching to us since January 2012 we’re sorry but you won’t get it again.

Take out up to £500 cash (or equivalent
currency) per account holder from cash
machines around the world.

data.ProductDescription: Our Basic Account is available to anyone applying for one of our accounts from an EU country outside the UK, and to UK citizens who are not eligible for one of our other current accounts

Eligibility.Description:
Eligibility of EU residents and UK customers - You may be able to get a Basic Account if you don’t meet the conditions for one of our other current accounts such as a Reward Account. This might be because you’re bankrupt, in financial difficulty, or if we’re not able to obtain information about your credit history (for example, because you live outside the UK). 
If you live in the UK - You cannot apply for a Basic account directly. If you apply for one of our other current accounts, we will try to obtain information about your credit history to decide the most appropriate account for you.

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: Payments up to and including £100; excluding payments from EU to a Basic Account, for which we waive the £2 fee
Payments over £100; excluding payments from EU to a Basic Account, for which we waive the £7 fee

Non-sterling purchase fee: fee charged per transaction when you make a purchase (not a cash withdrawal or purchase of foreign currency or travellers cheques). fee is applicable only to debit card transactions. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

Non-sterling cash fee :fee charged for withdrawal of cash abroad using your debit card. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

FeeDetail.Other: Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account for sterling value of £100 or less, whether negotiating or collecting

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: For cheque values <= £100, whether collecting or negotiating
For cheque values over £100: our minimum charge will be £15 when we collect the cheque.
Excluding payments to EU from a Basic Account for which we waive £9.50

The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

FeeDetail.Other: Charge for negotiating Foreign Cheques paid in to the account for sterling value more than £100 where we negotiate the cheque

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: For cheque values over £100: our minimum charge will be  £8  when we negotiate the cheque

Foreign cash fee : fee charged if you choose to complete your debit card cash withdrawal using the ATM provider's conversion rate to sterling. The ATM provider may make a separate charge for conversion which will be included in the exchange rate offered to you. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

1) Two people using one account - A simple way to share spends and see them on one monthly statement
2) Both account holders get a Visa debit card
3) Both account holders can also separately set up and manage Online Banking
Both account holders must be aged 18 or over

data.ProductDescription:
Tailored for teens aged 11 to 17 years, the Expresscash account can help you make the
most of your pocket money.
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: Earn 1.50% gross/1.51% AER credit interest on your account on any credit balances

Eligibility.Description:
11-12 year olds
A parent or guardian must be with you when you open your account or if you apply for more services. You cannot apply online and can only apply for an Expresscash account in branch. You’ll need to bring:-
Proof of ID (such as passport or birth certificate)
Proof of your parent/guardian’s identity and address (such as a utility bill dated in the last 6 months)

13-15 year olds
A parent or guardian must be with you when you open your account or if you apply for more services. Apply online today, then go into a Halifax branch with a parent or guardian. You’ll need to bring:-
Proof of ID (such as passport or birth certificate)
Proof of your parent/guardian’s identity and address (such as a utility bill dated in the last 6 months)

16-17 year olds
Apply online today then go into a Halifax branch. You don’t need to be accompanied by a parent or guardian, but you’ll need to bring:
Proof of ID (such as passport or birth certificate)
Proof of your parent/guardian’s identity and address (such as a utility bill dated in the last 6 months)

data.ProductDescription: A simple current account that rewards you each month.
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: If you are overdrawn by £50 or less our overdraft buffer means you won’t pay any planned or unplanned overdraft fees. Overdrafts are subject to application and approval, and are repayable on demand.

£3 reward each month you pay in £750 or more, pay out at least 2 different direct debits and stay in credit. If in any month you miss out on the £3 reward, you can still get it in future months too (when you meet the qualifying requirements.

Eligibility.Description: To apply for a Halifax Reward Current Account you must be 18 or over and a UK resident.

OverdraftPricing.OverdraftNotes: Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month you wont receive a £3 reward payment

REPRESENTATIVE EXAMPLE:
IF YOU USE A PLANNED OVERDRAFT OF £1,200, THEN WE'LL CHARGE YOU A DAILY FEE OF £1. Monthly charges are based on maximum of 35 days if month ends with Bank holidays. Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month you wont receive a £3 reward payment

REPRESENTATIVE EXAMPLE:
IF YOU USE A PLANNED OVERDRAFT OF £1,200, THEN WE'LL CHARGE YOU A DAILY FEE OF £1. Monthly charges are based on maximum of 35days if month ends with Bank holidays.Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month you wont receive a £3 reward payment

If you are overdrawn by £50 or less our overdraft buffer means you won’t pay any planned or unplanned overdraft fees. Overdrafts are subject to application and approval, and are repayable on demand. Monthly charges are based on maximum of 35days if month ends with Bank holidays.Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month you wont receive a £3 reward payment
Daily charge has maximum of 20 charges within any billing period.Remember if you don’t remain in credit during the month you wont receive a £3 reward payment

BenefitDetail.BenefitDescription: Get up to 15% cashback using Cashback Extras at the type of places you regularly shop. It’s available to UK personal current account customers over 18, who bank online. Retailer offers and cashback amounts may vary.  Register online and activate each offer you want to use.

£75 extra, paid before your switch completes. Just use the Current Account Switch Service to transfer and close your old account held elsewhere. If you’ve received cashback for switching to us since January 2012 we’re sorry but you won’t get it again.

Sign up for our Text Alerts, which can help you keep track of your finances. Limit Alerts tell you if you're near to or over your account limit. You can also get Balance Alerts that let you know when your balance is above or below a level set by you.

data.ProductDescription: Student Current Account. Awesome if you’re going places.
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: An interest-free planned overdraft for the length of your course plus an extra year after you graduate, up to a maximum of 6 years. (Overdrafts are repayable on demand and subject to status)
Credit interest on any credit balance 0.10% AER (0.10% gross) variable. Interest is paid monthly

Eligibility.Description: Aged 18 or over, and you must be studying full time on a degree course or equivalent course of further education. The longest you can hold an account is 6 years, including the year after you finish being in full-time education. Once you stop qualifying, these conditions no longer apply. We will write to tell you about the changes to your account at least 2 months before.

OverdraftPricing.OverdraftNotes: No debit interst or unplanned overdraft monthly fee if you are in debit  £10 or less
